summary: Federal Bureau of Prisons incident report documenting that inmate Jeffrey Epstein engaged in self-mutilation in his SHU cell at MCC New York on July 23, 2019. The report details the discovery, medical response, and subsequent disciplinary investigation where Epstein invoked his right to remain silent.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who engaged in self-mutilation in his SHU cell at MCC New York, was found with a rope around his neck, and invoked his right to remain silent during the investigation.

events.title: Epstein Self-Mutilation Incident
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, staff at MCC New York discovered inmate Jeffrey Epstein in SHU cell 124 with a rope around his neck, having attempted self-harm. He was unresponsive but breathing, and was removed from the cell for medical attention.

events.title: Disciplinary Investigation
events.description: A lieutenant conducted an investigation of the self-mutilation incident, advised Epstein of his rights, and noted Epstein stated 'I no comment at this time' and had a poor attitude. The report was referred to the UDC for further disposition.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his SHU cell at MCC New York on July 23, 2019, at 1:27 AM with a rope around his neck in an act of self-mutilation.
Epstein was unresponsive but breathing when discovered; staff removed the rope and he was taken out of the SHU for medical attention.
During the disciplinary investigation on July 30, 2019, Epstein invoked his right to remain silent, stating 'I no comment at this time' and was noted to have a poor attitude.
The incident report was served late due to Epstein being on suicide watch following the event.
